Pemangkasan Eselon, Pengamat: Pemerintah Harus Antisipasi Hal Ini
04 Nov 2019, 13:36 by Antara, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Rencana pemangkasan eselon III dan IV dinilai sejumlah pengamat harus dibarengi dengan langkah-langkah antisipasi perlambatan birokrasi. Tanpa antisipasi, rencana itu malah akan bertentangan dengan tujuan awal pemangkasan eselon untuk menyederhanakan proses birokrasi agar bisa pada akhirnya memperbaiki iklim investasi.
Pengamat kebijakan publik Agus Pambagio menyebutkan perlambatan birokrasi bisa terjadi karena realisasi pemangkasan eselon butuh waktu lama. Terlebih saat ini, pemangkasan eselon masih dalam tataran wacana.
"Sekarang ini baru sebatas pernyataan, usulannya belum terlihat," kata Agus, Senin, 4 November 2019. Padahal, kata dia, daripada melakukan pemangkasan para pejabat eselon III dan IV, sebaiknya presiden membenahi birokrasinya terlebih dahulu.
Hal itu dapat dilakukan dengan pengoptimalan fungsi birokrasi yang ada serta memanfaatkan kemajuan teknologi saat ini. "Sekarang sudah ada sistem online, pejabat dalam birokrasi tidak harus bertatap muka. Manfaatkan dulu," ujar dia.
Ia melihat benang merah yang menjadi sorotan presiden ialah persoalan birokrasi. Oleh karena itu, pemangkasan eselon disarankan tidak perlu dilakukan. "Jadi intinya birokrasinya saja diberesin. Kalau beresin eselon bisa, hanya saja lama dan buang waktu," katanya.
Sebelumnya, rencana perampingan birokrasi melalui penyederhanaan jabatan eselon di kementerian telah disampaikan Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi usai dirinya dikukuhkan sebagai presiden periode 2019-2024. Jokowi menuturkan penyederhanaan birokrasi harus terus dilakukan besar-besaran. Investasi untuk penciptaan lapangan kerja harus diprioritaskan.
Hal senada disampaikan pengamat politik Karyono Wibowo. Ia mewanti-wanti agar pemerintah memperhatikan jenjang karier para pejabat eselon III dan IV yang dihilangkan.
Pemerintah, kata Karyono, harus menjelaskan kepada publik secara rinci dan jelas perihal kebijakan pemangkasan eselon itu. "Jangan sampai menimbulkan kerancuan, ukuran atau kriteria untuk menjadi pejabat eselon II dan I itu seperti apa nantinya. Itu juga harus dijelaskan lebih detail, tahapannya bagaimana," ucapnya.
Menteri Pendayagunaan Aparatur Negara dan Reformasi Birokrasi Tjahjo Kumolo menyatakan, sebagai langkah awal, pihaknya akan melakukan penghapusan pejabat eselon III dan IV di kementerian yang dipimpin. Realisasinya ditargetkan pada November 2019. Adapun aturan ini akan diterapkan menyeluruh di seluruh Indonesia dalam satu tahun ke depan.
Di sisi lain, pemerintah harus pula menerangkan posisi apa yang diterima para eselon III dan IV. Apalagi pegawai di eselon III dan IV diperkirakan mencapai 400.000 ribu lebih. "Kalau pejabat eselon III dan IV ditiadakan lalu posisinya seperti apa. Nah ini yang perlu dijelaskan supaya tidak menimbulkan kekhawatiran dan kekhawatiran," ujar Tjahjo Kumolo.

Echelon Trimming, Observers: The Government Must Anticipate This
Nov. 04 2019, 13:36 by Antara, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The echelon III and IV pruning plan is considered by a number of observers to be accompanied by measures to anticipate a bureaucratic slowdown. Without anticipation, the plan will actually contradict the original goal of reducing echelon to simplify the bureaucratic process so that it can ultimately improve the investment climate.
Public policy analyst Agus Pambagio said the slowdown in the bureaucracy could occur because the realization of echelon pruning takes a long time. Especially at this time, echelon pruning is still at the level of discourse.
"Now this is only a statement, the proposal has not yet been seen," Agus said, Monday, November 4, 2019. In fact, he said, instead of pruning echelon III and IV officials, the president should fix the bureaucracy first.
This can be done by optimizing existing bureaucratic functions and utilizing current technological advancements. "Now there is an online system, officials in the bureaucracy do not have to meet face to face. Take advantage first," he said.
He saw the common thread that became the president's spotlight was the issue of bureaucracy. Therefore, echelon pruning is recommended not necessary. "So the point is that the bureaucracy will be taken care of. If the echelon is settled, it can only be a long time and waste of time," he said.
Previously, the plan to streamline the bureaucracy through simplification of echelon positions in the ministry had been submitted by President Joko Widodo or Jokowi after he was confirmed as president in the 2019-2024 period. Jokowi said that simplification of bureaucracy must continue to be carried out on a large scale. Investment in job creation must be prioritized.
The same thing was conveyed by political observer Karyono Wibowo. He warned the government to pay attention to the career paths of echelon III and IV officials who were removed.
The government, said Karyono, must explain to the public in detail and clearly the policy of trimming the echelon. "Do not cause confusion, size or criteria to become echelon II and I officials like what will become. It must also be explained in more detail, how the stages are," he said.
Minister of Administrative Reform and Bureaucracy Reform Tjahjo Kumolo said, as a first step, his party would carry out the removal of echelon III and IV officials in the ministry it leads. The realization is targeted for November 2019. The regulation will be implemented comprehensively throughout Indonesia in the next one year.
On the other hand, the government must also explain what position is accepted by echelon III and IV. Moreover, employees in echelon III and IV are estimated at more than 400,000 thousand. "If echelon III and IV officials are removed then what position will it be. Well this needs to be explained so as not to cause concern and concern," said Tjahjo Kumolo.
